overview: 3001 provides geospatial solutions in the United States. It offers geospatial data production and analysis services, including airborne imaging, surveying, mapping, and geographic information systems. The company also provides photo-grammetric and remote sensing services. Its products and services are used for civilian, defense, and intelligence initiatives; developing and maintaining public and private sector infrastructure; and for understanding the land and its resources. 3001, Inc. was formerly known as Vernon F. Meyer and Associates. The company was founded in 1965 and is headquartered in Fairfax, Virginia. It has office locations in Slidell, Louisiana; Gainesville, Florida; Stennis Space Center, Mississippi; Theodore and Huntsville, Alabama; St. Louis, Missouri; and Peachtree City, Georgia. As of October 2, 2008, 3001, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Northrop Grumman Corporation.

acquisition.source_description: Northrop Grumman to Acquire 3001 International, Inc.
